data.title: heavy" author. What is mean by "initi...
data.meta_description: JK Rowling is an initialheavy author What is mean by initialheavy - trivia question /questions answer / answers
data.text:
That is a term used to describe someone who presents their name with multiple initials, rather than just a first name or a first name and a middle initial. J.D. Salinger, J. R. R. Tolkien, G. K. Chesterton, C. S. Lewis, A. A. Milne - the list is long!

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_literary_initials

May 05 2022, 10:29 PM

I don't really think that using the initials instead of her given name (Joanne) makes her "initial-heavy". Instead it's the rather impressive letters used after her name: J. K. Rowling CH OBE HonFRSE FRCPE FRSL.

In order, these stand for:

CH = Companion of Honour

OBE = Officer of the Order of the British Empire

HonFRSE = Honorary Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh

FRCPE = Fellow of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh

FRSL = Fellow of the Roycal Society of Literature

The WikiPage for Ms Rowling contains clickable links that explains more what each honor is about.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._K._Rowling

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Companion_of_Honour

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Officer_of_the_Order_of_the_British_Empire

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Honorary_Fellow_of_the_Royal_Society_of_Edinburgh

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fellow_of_the_Royal_College_of_Physicians_of_Edinburgh

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fellow_of_the_Royal_Society_of_Literature

May 30 2022, 7:28 AM
